node.doctext:
Primary Purpose

Category nodes will serve as the de facto standard for "grouping" related nodes.

Project Goals

  • Allow users and usergroups to "own" categories (and thus edit them.)
  • Create a [category] linktype to use to link nodes to category nodes.
  • Create a category opcode to handle adding/editing/removing category linktypes.
  • Create an easy to use interface to add nodes to categories. My own thoughts are to set $$VARS{currentcategory} as needed, then have a link near the "bookmark!" link that says "add to CURRENT CATEGORY", along with a link "add to ANOTHER CATEGORY", which will take them to a page listing all the categories they are allowed to edit.
  • Conversely, we'll need to make the node bucket code available to everyone (sanitized, naturally) so they can visit nodes, create a bucket ready for categorizing, and then create / visit the category and place all of their collected nodes within it.
  • We should probably make the Node Bucket its own nodelet.
  • We should have a [Random Category] nodelet for the front page, that displays the category name, a snippet of a random node from the random category (a la [Cream of the Cool]), 5-10 links to other nodes within the category, and of course a link to the category node itself.
  • We should have a couple of different displaytypes for category pages: display should just give you a list of the links in alphabetical order, while random should give you a random node, with navigational options to traverse through the rest of the nodes.

Questions

  • Are all those username_root categories going to stay? If so, what is their purpose? kthejoker - They may or may not stay. I'm leaning towards getting rid of them. Their original purpose (the entire category node's purpose) was to replace the metanode concept. The _root category nodes were going to contain other category nodes, such as "user bookmarks", "user writeups", etc etc to kind of provide a hierarchy for nodes based by user.
  • Will all users be able to update (user-based) categories, or is this a level power or by special permission only? kthejoker - I was thinking of making it a level 2 power. Either that or it's open for everybody. This is a feature I want to subsequently publicize and "do things with", like automate quest submissions and such.
  • Will usergroup categories be editable by the entire group, or just the group leader? kthejoker - everyone in the group.
  • Will categories be significantly different than "tagging"? kthejoker - Yes, signifitcantly. This is more like "metanodes", or Amazon lists. Think "A European Travelogue", "Albums I Own", "11 Writeups About Love", "The Definitive Guide To Star Trek", etc etc.
  • Correct me if I'm wrong, but a quick look at the category and links table makes me think that the nodes in a category will be defined as:

    links table

    • from_node: category_id
    • to_node: node_id of categorized node (all displayable nodetypes or just a subset?) (we'll have to create a [category] opcode that inserts entries here (similar to [bookmark] opcode), we'll do any filtering out of inappropriate entries there)
    • linktype: 1935395 (node_id of category linktype)
    • hits: not used for this linktype? (yes, not used, nor is food)
    • food: I have no idea what this is for at all (food = "weight" of link)

Progress

NOTE: All of this should be considered in in test/beta mode. I will clean up the code (i.e., make things pageable, fix the formatting, write appropriate descriptions, etc.) once everything actually works. Also note that I might switch back from 'nodelist' to 'category' to avoid confusion (isalso links are going to say "XXX is also a category")

  • [Create Category] (working) - superdoc to create a new category
  • [Display Categories] (working) - superdoc to list categories (NOTE: paging needs to be added)
  • [category] (working) - opcode to create a new category
  • [category] (working) - nodetype (NOTE: I have set "restrict duplicate titles" to "no". This is so multiple users can have their own "My Favorite Movies" (or whatever) category. [category maintenance create] ensures that two categories with the same name AND same maintainer cannot be created.
  • [Nodelists] (working) - nodelet to list categories you can add to (NOTE: The interface may need to be changed as some noders may eventually have hundreds of lists they can edit, and the ability to add the current node to a category. Also, I'd like to move the bookmark link from the epicenter to this nodelet, because basically, bookmarks and nodelists are very similar kthejoker *sigh* we'll have to make this a [user settings] since some people won't turn on this nodelet. We can talk about this, anyway.)
  • [category maintenance create] (working) - maintenance node for creating categories
  • [category display page] (working, old code needs to be removed) - htmlpage to display categories
  • [category edit page] (working, old code needs to be removed) - htmlpage to edit (i.e., delete links from) categories
  • [E2 Client Development] and [zen theme] (working) - good sample categories to view

TODO:

  • Link to the category from nodes contained in the category

  • Display user categories on homenodes]
    STATUS: not started

  • Display usergroup categories on usergroup pages]
    STATUS: not started

  • fix bug in [create category] page. maintainer (author_user) is being set to current user no matter what selection is made

  • enable add/edit doctext for [create category] and [category edit page]

  • Design [Create Category] form
    kthejoker this should be revised to using op new and then a [category maintenance create] maintenance node to authenticate/deny category node creations. So the full process is: 1) create maintenance node (BETA) and assign it to the [category] nodetype (DONE) (visit the nodetype node, the option is there: 2) use the Create Category page to post the three parameters needed to create new nodes: nodetype, title, and op=new, (DONE) and then 3) modify the maintenance node as necessary to deny invalid attempts (BETA) (you may also look at [writeup maintenance create] for general guiding principles.)

  • Write new [category|opcode]

  • Write new [nodelists|nodelet]

  • Design [Display Categories] page (QUESTION: Should categories use the doctext field as a "lede" to the category? kthejoker seems reasonable.)

  • Design Edit Category form (QUESTION: should the same users who can add a node be able to edit/delete?
    kthejoker yes, absolutely.)
